[TITLE]
<line: 4> IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT 
<line: 5> FOR THE DISTRICT OF ARIZONA 

[TITLE]
<line: 7> United States of America 

[TEXT]
<line: 9> JUDGMENT IN A CRIMINAL CASE 
<line: 10> (For Offenses Committed On or After November 1, 1987) 

[TEXT]
<line: 12> v. 

[TEXT]
<line: 14> No.  CR-16-01164-001-PHX-GMS 

[TITLE]
<line: 16> Roberto Serrano 

[TEXT]
<line: 18> Maria Teresa Weidner (FPD) 
<line: 19> Attorney for Defendant 

[TEXT]
<line: 21> USM#: 64902-408 

[TITLE]
<line: 23> THE DEFENDANT ENTERED A PLEA OF guilty on 11/8/2016 to Count 2 of the Indictment. 

[TEXT]
<line: 25> ACCORDINGLY, THE COURT HAS ADJUDICATED THAT THE DEFENDANT IS GUILTY 
<line: 26> OF THE FOLLOWING OFFENSE(S): violating Title 21, U.S.C. §§ 841(a)(1) and (b)(1)(C), 
<line: 27> Possession with Intent to Distribute Methamphetamine, a Class C Felony offense, as charged in Count 
<line: 28> 2 of the Indictment. 

[TEXT]
<line: 30> IT IS THE JUDGMENT OF THIS COURT THAT the defendant is committed to the custody of the 
<line: 31> Bureau of Prisons for a term of TWENTY-FOUR (24) MONTHS, with credit for time served. Upon 
<line: 32> release from imprisonment, the defendant shall be placed on supervised release for a term of THREE 
<line: 33> (3) YEARS. 

[TEXT]
<line: 35> The Court recommends that the defendant participates in the Bureau of Prisons Residential Drug Abuse 
<line: 36> Treatment Program. 

[TEXT]
<line: 38> IT IS ORDERED that Count 1 is dismissed on motion of the United States. 

[TITLE]
<line: 40> CRIMINAL MONETARY PENALTIES 

[TEXT]
<line: 42> The defendant shall pay to the Clerk the following total criminal monetary penalties: 

[TEXT]
<line: 44> SPECIAL ASSESSMENT: $100.00 
<line: 45> FINE: WAIVED 
<line: 46> RESTITUTION: N/A 

[TEXT]
<line: 48> The defendant shall pay a special assessment of $100.00 which shall be due immediately. 

[TEXT]
<line: 50> The Court finds the defendant does not have the ability to pay a fine and orders the fine waived. 

[TEXT]
<line: 52> The defendant shall pay a total of $100.00 in criminal monetary penalties, due immediately. Having 
<line: 53> assessed the defendant's ability to pay, payments of the total criminal monetary penalties are due as 
<line: 54> follows: Balance is due in equal monthly installments of $25.00 over a period of 4 months to 
<line: 55> commence 60 days after the release from imprisonment to a term of supervised release. 1231231

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 2:16-cr-01164-GMS   Document 36   Filed 02/27/17   Page 2 of 4

[ABANDON]
<line: 4> CR-16-01164-001-PHX-GMS 
<line: 5> USA vs. Roberto Serrano  

[ABANDON]
<line: 7> Page 2 of 4 

[TEXT]
<line: 9> If incarcerated, payment of criminal monetary penalties are due during imprisonment at a rate of not less than $25 per quarter 
<line: 10> and payment shall be made through the Bureau of Prisons' Inmate Financial Responsibility  Program.  Criminal monetary 
<line: 11> payments shall be made to the Clerk of U.S. District Court, Attention: Finance, Suite 130, 401 West Washington Street, SPC 1, 
<line: 12> Phoenix, Arizona 85003-2118. Payments should be credited to the various monetary penalties imposed by the Court in the 
<line: 13> priority established under 18 U.S.C. § 3612(c). The total special assessment of $100.00 shall be paid pursuant to Title 18, 
<line: 14> United States Code, Section 3013 for Count 2 of the Indictment. 

[TEXT]
<line: 16> Any unpaid balance shall become a condition of supervision and shall be paid within 90 days prior to the expiration of 
<line: 17> supervision.  Until all restitutions, fines, special assessments and costs are fully paid, the defendant shall immediately notify the 
<line: 18> Clerk, U.S. District Court, of any change in name and address. The Court hereby waives the imposition of interest and penalties 
<line: 19> on any unpaid balances. 

[TITLE]
<line: 21> SUPERVISED RELEASE 

[TEXT]
<line: 23> It is the order of the Court that, pursuant to General Order 16-23, which incorporates the requirements 
<line: 24> of USSG §§5B1.3 and 5D1.2, you shall comply with the following conditions: 

[TITLE]
<line: 26> MANDATORY CONDITIONS 

[TEXT]
<line: 28> 1) 
<line: 29> You must not commit another federal, state or local crime. 
<line: 30> 2) 
<line: 31> You must not unlawfully possess a controlled substance. The use or possession of marijuana, 
<line: 32> even with a physician's certification, is not permitted. 
<line: 33> 3) 
<line: 34> You must refrain from any unlawful use of a controlled substance. The use or possession of 
<line: 35> marijuana, even with a physician's certification, is not permitted. Unless suspended by the Court, 
<line: 36> you must submit to one drug test within 15 days of release from imprisonment and at least two 
<line: 37> periodic drug tests thereafter, as determined by the court. 

[TITLE]
<line: 39> STANDARD CONDITIONS 

[TEXT]
<line: 41> 1) 
<line: 42> You must report to the probation office in the federal judicial district where you are authorized 
<line: 43> to reside within 72 hours of sentencing or your release from imprisonment, unless the probation 
<line: 44> officer instructs you to report to a different probation office or within a different time frame. 
<line: 45> 2) 
<line: 46> After initially reporting to the probation office, you will receive instructions from the court or 
<line: 47> the probation officer about how and when you must report to the probation officer, and you must 
<line: 48> report to the probation officer as instructed. 
<line: 49> 3) 
<line: 50> You must not knowingly leave the federal judicial district where you are authorized to reside 
<line: 51> without first getting permission from the court or the probation officer. 
<line: 52> 4) 
<line: 53> You must answer truthfully the questions asked by your probation officer. 
<line: 54> 5) 
<line: 55> You must live at a place approved by the probation officer. If you plan to change where you live 
<line: 56> or anything about your living arrangements (such as the people you live with), you must notify 
<line: 57> the probation officer at least 10 days before the change. If notifying the probation officer in 1231231

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 2:16-cr-01164-GMS   Document 36   Filed 02/27/17   Page 3 of 4

[ABANDON]
<line: 4> CR-16-01164-001-PHX-GMS 
<line: 5> USA vs. Roberto Serrano  

[ABANDON]
<line: 7> Page 3 of 4 

[TEXT]
<line: 9> advance is not possible due to unanticipated circumstances, you must notify the probation 
<line: 10> officer within 72 hours of becoming aware of a change or expected change. 

[TEXT]
<line: 12> 6) 
<line: 13> You must allow the probation officer to visit you at any time at your home or elsewhere, and 
<line: 14> you must permit the probation officer to take any items prohibited by the conditions of your 
<line: 15> supervision that he or she observes in plain view. 

[TEXT]
<line: 17> 7) 
<line: 18> You must work full time (at least 30 hours per week) at a lawful type of employment, unless the 
<line: 19> probation officer excuses you from doing so.  If you do not have full-time employment you must 
<line: 20> try to find full-time employment, unless the probation officer excuses you from doing so. If you 
<line: 21> plan to change where you work or anything about your work (such as your position or your job 
<line: 22> responsibilities), you must notify the probation officer at least 10 days before the change. If 
<line: 23> notifying the probation officer at least 10 days in advance is not possible due to unanticipated 
<line: 24> circumstances, you must notify the probation officer within 72 hours of becoming aware of a 
<line: 25> change or expected change. 

[TEXT]
<line: 27> 8) 
<line: 28> You must not communicate or interact with someone you know is engaged in criminal activity.  
<line: 29> If you know someone has been convicted of a felony, you must not knowingly communicate or 
<line: 30> interact with that person without first getting the permission of the probation officer. 

[TEXT]
<line: 32> 9) 
<line: 33> If you are arrested or questioned by a law enforcement officer, you must notify the probation 
<line: 34> officer within 72 hours. 

[TEXT]
<line: 36> 10) 
<line: 37> You must not own, possess, or have access to a firearm, ammunition, destructive device, or 
<line: 38> dangerous weapon (i.e., anything that was designed, or was modified for, the specific purpose of 
<line: 39> causing bodily injury or death to another person such as nunchakus or tasers). 

[TEXT]
<line: 41> 11) 
<line: 42> You must not act or make any agreement with a law enforcement agency to act as a confidential 
<line: 43> human source or informant without first getting the permission of the court. 

[TEXT]
<line: 45> 12) 
<line: 46> If the probation officer determines that you pose a risk to another person (including an 
<line: 47> organization), the probation officer may require you to notify the person about the risk and you 
<line: 48> must comply with that instruction. The probation officer may contact the person and confirm 
<line: 49> that you have notified the person about the risk. 

[TEXT]
<line: 51> 13) 
<line: 52> You must follow the instructions of the probation officer related to the conditions of 
<line: 53> supervision. 

[TITLE]
<line: 55> SPECIAL CONDITIONS 

[TEXT]
<line: 57> The following special conditions are in addition to the conditions of supervised release or supersede 
<line: 58> any related standard condition: 

[TEXT]
<line: 60> 1) 
<line: 61> You shall participate as instructed by the probation officer in a program of substance abuse 
<line: 62> treatment which may include testing for substance abuse. You shall contribute to the cost of 
<line: 63> treatment in an amount to be determined by the probation officer. 1231231

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 2:16-cr-01164-GMS  Document 36  Filed 02/27/17 Page 4 of 4

[ABANDON]
<line: 4> CR-16-01164-001-PHX-GMS
<line: 5> USA vs. Roberto Serrano

[ABANDON]
<line: 7> Page 4 of 4

[TEXT]
<line: 9> 2)
<line: 10> You shall submit your person, property, house, residence, vehicle, papers, or office, to a search
<line: 11> conducted by a probation officer. Failure to submit to a search may be grounds for revocation of.
<line: 12> release. You shall warn any other occupants that the premises may be subject to searches.
<line: 13> pursuant to this condition..
<line: 14> 3)
<line: 15> You shall abstain from all use of alcohol or alcoholic beverages..
<line: 16> 4)
<line: 17> You shall participate in anger management counseling as directed by your probation officer.
<line: 18> You shall contribute to the cost of treatment in an amount to be determined by the probation
<line: 19> officer

[TEXT]
<line: 21> THE COURT FINDS that you have been sentenced in accordance with the terms of the plea
<line: 22> agreement and that you have waived your right to appeal and to collaterally attack this matter. The.
<line: 23> waiver has been knowingly and voluntarily made with a factual basis and with an understanding of the
<line: 24> consequences of the waiver.

[TEXT]
<line: 26> The Court may change the conditions of probation or supervised release or extend the term of.
<line: 27> supervision, if less than the authorized maximum, at any time during the period of probation or
<line: 28> supervised release. The Court may issue a warrant and revoke the original or any subsequent sentence
<line: 29> for a violation occurring during the period of probation or supervised release..

[TEXT]
<line: 31> The Court orders commitment to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons and recommends that the
<line: 32> defendant participates in the Bureau of Prisons Residential Drug Abuse Treatment Program.

[TEXT]
<line: 34> The defendant is remanded to the custody of the United States Marshal.

[TEXT]
<line: 36> Date of Imposition of Sentence: Friday, February 24, 2017

[TITLE]
<line: 38> H. Muay 
<line: 39> /G. Murray Snow
<line: 40> United States District Judge
<line: 41> RETURN

[TEXT]
<line: 43> Dated this 27th day of February, 2017.

[TEXT]
<line: 45> I have executed this Judgment as follows:
<line: 46> , the institution
<line: 47>  defendant delivered on
